Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Reporting, Cash Flow and Your Business’ Financial Health  Posted on June 1, 2018 by Michelle Mire  Like 64.4% of businesses, you use accounting software to help keep your finances on track by systematically recording your income and expenses and other crucial data. In turn, this information becomes the foundation for key financial statements, like your balance sheet, profit and loss statement and cash flow statement.  Why should you routinely review your business’ financial statements?  According to Mike Kappel, CEO of Patriot Software, the best way to measure success is to look at your financial statements. “Measuring business performance means checking out the money flow (cash flow) of your business. If you want to see how profitable your business is, check out the financial statements.”  For the remainder of the article, click on the below web-link:  https://blog.paypie.com/uncategorized/reporting-cash-flow-and-your-business-financial-health/

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hot off the press.  Updates from PAYPIE.  We acknowledge that the further clarifications are necessary for the community to better understand the situation we face regarding the regulatory scene in our local crypto space. Canada is a very rigorous and responsible country, and we respect our premium institutions and regulatory bodies. It is our understanding that only companies that fully abide by guidelines can thrive and remain viable in the long term.  As some of you know, our team has been in direct, close, and constant contact with our local regulators since July 2017, so far over 10 long months now. We have been nothing but completely cooperative. Our founders have personally spent over 500 hours directly working with our legal team toward achieving an efficient outcome and we are making positive progress. We strongly believe that we have the best legal team in the country in place to move things forward in this kind of environment.   Despite all this effort, things have been taking vastly longer than we all expected and that is causing everybody unnecessary hassles that are out of our control. The company won't adopt a reckless posture and act according to its own will disregarding what the competent bodies might think or say. Our team is aware that there are other companies in similar positions that are choosing that path and doing things their own way. We don't see a bright future coming from such practices. A look at the history shows us that Napster was doomed even after having the first-mover advantage while Spotify and iTunes are still thriving for having engaged with regulators to solve a real problem.   The scope of this update is to inform the community that the team shares your frustration. The company and the community are in the same boat together. All navigating through rough waters in the pursuit of peaceful times that is coming as we move forward on a certainly positive path. We are developing a business to grow in a way that is strategically correct for the long run. We are building PayPie to thrive for years to come, and we can do it better while working with regulatory bodies. We do understand the importance of having a platform where tokens can be bought and sold in a safe and secure environment and we will pursue it at the right time.  We also know that sometimes the community can be anxious about more frequent updates from the team and we have tried to keep you updated with one or two monthly emails. It's important to keep in mind that we are also always available for clarifications through our Contact Us form on our website.  There are numerous improvements being done on the platform. We are currently working on an entire cash flow forecasting system to be implemented in the coming weeks. This will let SMEs clearly see when they would be in a negative cash flow position so that they can plan ahead and take advantage of invoice factoring for immediate access to cash. The cash flow forecasting will feed the data right into our credit risk assessment on the blockchain and will be invaluable.   The SMEs outreach has been constant, and we now have more than 200 (!) SMEs signed up. That's a quite respectable number already for only one month of Beta and we will make full efforts for it to keep growing exponentially with time. A good number of them have successfully connected their QBO accounts to the platform and the remaining ones will also be onboarded. We have a real-value-first approach to achieving our goals. Real value first, viral exposure later – not the other way around.   We are also thrilled to share that one of the most skilled experts in the content writing fintech industry has joined our ranks – our new Content Writer and Strategist, Michelle Mire. She is debuting on the PayPie blog with a rock-solid article about reporting, cash flow and how to improve your business' financial health, so go nuts and share it at will: https://blog.paypie.com/uncategorized/reporting-cash-flow-and-your-business-financial-health/  Best,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: Wheelige
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hey guys, I'm also in the boat of wanting Paypie to be on a nice big centralized exchange because of the attention that will give to Paypie and the ease of access (ether/forkdelta are not the most user friendly exchanges even if they do have their positives).  My understanding is that Paypie are not in a position to list their tokens on such exchanges due to concerns from regulators in Canada. They have been engaged in a conversation with them from very early on in their development and are being required to show the utility of their token before being able to get the exemption which would allow them to list without having to complete the paperwork required to be listed as a security. This means that they need to have their platform going so that the utility exists. Obviously there is little they can do about Ether/Forkdelta and i believe that the team has requested that fatbtc delist their coin.  It is just a matter of time before its listed on a bigger exchange however the delay is not due to lethargy or stalling its due to compliance from a team that wants to deliver a product and has a clear path to do that.

Given the crypto environment and the ease for a 'trusted' third party to freeze funds and steal them I'd only use trusted exchanges (and fork/etherdelta).

PayPie will now have instant access to millions of QuickBooks Online business users as potential customers since the very beginning. PayPie Blog - A New Era Begins blog: https://blog.paypie.com/about-paypie/a-new-era-begins/  AccountingToday - News story: https://www.accountingtoday.com/news/blockchain-based-credit-risk-assessment-platform-paypie-launches-in-beta  CCN - Full press release: https://www.ccn.com/paypie-launches-live-beta-with-quickbooks-integration/   Enjoy Beta! We are just getting started!  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: We’ve come a long way since this all has started. Partnerships, team expansions, development, Alpha release, and even a brand new house – our revamped website. PayPie has been through a lot during all this time and, along with it, our beloved community composed by some of the most passionate and fearless supporters that any company can have has kept always moving forward no matter what. Steadily. Strongly. Imperatively.  Now, at the dawn of a new era for the blockchain fintech scene, emerges a giant. Beta. Beautiful. Bombastic. A landmark in the history of the entire crypto world regardless of nation, community, or industry. A giant born with the greatness of a ground-breaking Intuit partnership to forever change the blockchain landscape.  Welcome to PayPie Beta. PayPie has partnered with the fintech powerhouse Intuit to deliver a QuickBooks Online integration straight at Beta launch. PayPie will now have instant access to millions of QuickBooks Online business users as potential customers since the very beginning. QuickBooks is one of the largest business accounting software in North America having over 80% of market share in the USA. Its online version accounts for a considerable piece of that and follows the latest industry cloud trend.  Small and medium-sized enterprises will be able to instantly connect their QBO accounts to PayPie to have access to their unique PayPie credit score and analytics insights to improve their business’ finances. SMEs’ real financial data histories will be assessed in near-real time by our automated credit risk assessment algorithm and their credit scores will be hashed to the Ethereum blockchain for ultimate transparency.  PayPie’s initial credit assessment and financial analytics insights are live now and available to all small SMEs using QBO as their primary accounting solution in the USA, Canada, UK, and Australia. Once businesses are all set on the platform, they will be able to sell their invoices in the marketplace to have access to fast and affordable funding from global invoice buyers. Our beta platform is live to be experienced with test tokens and improved functionalities will be introduced in stages, including turning the switch to real token usage.  PayPie’s legal team remains closely working with our local authorities to solve any outstanding aspects of the platform and we are willing to take the necessary steps and abide by required regulations safeguarding for the long-term best interests of the company and of our token holders’ community. Our bright future awaits and it will always be built on solid and responsible foundations.  The horizon is coming and it belongs to PayPie. Our marketing outreach starts this week and a comprehensive approach will come to place. Beta is a nice and shiny platform still in very early stages and there are plenty of more developments to come. In last few months, many amazing talents have joined our ranks including a former Goldman Sachs executive with expertise in credit risk assessment with specific expertise background in the invoice factoring industry. We are serious about disrupting the ways that businesses improve their finances and we are going big at it.  Enjoy Beta! We are just getting started!

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Paypie (as well as Populous. I own both) will disrupt the traditional invoice financing system by eliminating the need for third parties or financial institutions by connecting businesses with global invoice buyers directly.  In other words, us token holders can get into loaning the funds directly to the invoice sellers at much more favourable costs to the seller and us buyers can earn income.  Paypies single ledger approach will significantly disrupt established legacy accounting workflows and regulators in all markets. There will be many uses of trustless accounting on the blockchain. Some other benefits achieved due to the meaningful application of the technology:  No re-keying of data by different parties  Less time spent in billing collaboration, e.g., following-up unpaid invoices, eliminating duplicate   invoices, ends duplication of efforts  Automatic distributed reconciliation of financial records  Automatic & seamless regulatory and compliance documentation  Traceable audit trails / automated audit process  Tracking ownership of assets  Significant savings on credit insurance, audit & review  The Paypie whitepaper should answer your questions in further detail.  https://www.paypie.com/Content/files/PayPie-Whitepaper-English.pdf

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: From Paypie today:  Beta Updates  April is here and Beta is just around the corner, so we have some updates for you. First, let's start with the main meat - Beta of our soon to be launched platform by the end of the month. Everything is on track and PayPie will have a Beta out of the gate within the next two weeks. That's close!   Our goal is to showcase the real work that is being done behind the scenes so you can have an idea of the breadth that PayPie will deliver on. If you are an SME (small and medium-sized enterprise), you will be able to directly connect your accounting software to PayPie with the click of a button. The platform will then apply its unique algorithm and perform a complete credit risk assessment of your business' s financial health and will give it a score to be hashed on the Ethereum blockchain. That means you can join PayPie as soon as we launch Beta and provide us the valuable feedback so that you can make your business ready to leverage the immense benefits that come with stellar financial performance analysis.   And Beta won't come alone. With it, PayPie's marketing campaigns will kick-off to bring the platform the exposure it deserves. We have developed a comprehensive marketing strategy that will be put in place and both SMEs and crypto audiences are at the core of it. During the initial Beta stages, our marketing efforts will be focused on creating awareness and bringing SMEs on the platform to spread adoption while enabling our risk analysis team to perfect the risk forecast.   Our brand new website will also come with Beta along with improved branding and our complete long-term value propositions. The website, as the platform, will reflect a real-world company with a real-world product that solves real-world problems. We are not about mere speculation, we are not about mere hype, we are about empowering token holders, accountants, lenders, and businesses with invaluable tools to transform their financials.   The PayPie Credit Marketplace will connect SMEs with potential invoice buyers and its functionalities will also be introduced with Beta in stages. At launch, Beta will feature test tokens so security procedures and bug-hunts can be implemented and optimized before real token operations take place. The safety of all funds handled on the platform will always come first and market best standards should be followed.  And then there are the regulatory aspects of remaining compliant. That is something that our team takes EXTREMELY seriously and we completely believe it will be a major differentiation factor in the blockchain field. As you know, our team sought to ensure compliance with the applicable local laws and have been in constant communication with the respective authorities in Canada from the very beginning. There are no shortcuts if one aims to disrupt the fintech industry while remaining compliant. We know that the road is long and painfully slow and we much appreciate your support during all this time, but this road has an end. We are in the final stages and we fully expect to have everything finalized before long. We can say that we are truly close. We. Are. Almost. There.  So stay fresh guys. The very best is yet to be served!  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hello crowd,  A couple of sweet updates for you today. As mentioned by our CEO, Nick Chandi, in PayPie's community Telegram group a few days ago, Beta launch is getting close and everything is on track for outstanding things to come. Our marketing strategy is neatly crafted to create the perfect storm in several promotional mediums at once and an avalanche of BIG things will take place altogether.  And no, if you wonder if the Debitum partnership announcement was the juicy news that we had to share the answer would be no. Our sweet PayPie is being baked to perfection and a lot will happen once the time comes. It looks like Christmas will arrive earlier this year! About a Beta launch, we don't have a confirmed date yet but the development is going as well as expected and Beta will be released on time.  On another topic, we're happy to announce that Derrick Liu, CPA, joined the PayPie team as our newest advisor! He will add tremendous value to future partnerships development and he represents a financial stronghold in Asian markets. Here's a short bio of Derrick:  "Derrick is the principal partner of Keyway Group, a regulated corporate service provider advising over 10,000 companies since its inception in 1979.  Derrick is an early investor in Bitcoin and through his group’s investment arm, has invested in numerous startups in the crypto space while often assisting them as a regulatory and tax advisor. He is a frequent speaker at various investment events and he is a fellow at the Hong Kong Institute of CPA and member of CPA Australia. "  And now without further ado let's move onto the sweetest news of the day - PayPie has officially joined the Ethereum Enterprise Alliance! The EEA opened its doors for PayPie to figure among its global reputable members such as Microsoft, Deloitte, Bancor, Accenture, Cisco, Dash, Intel, ING, Santander, Ledger Wallet, and CreditSuisse. Check it out!   PAYPIE JOINS THE ETHEREUM ENTERPRISE ALLIANCE  VANCOUVER/BC, CANADA – March 2, 2018 – PayPie announced today that it joined the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA), the world's largest open source blockchain initiative with over 400 member companies. PayPie joined EEA to enhance its contributions as a trusted leading enterprise in the blockchain industry and to support the adoption of Ethereum-based technology in the enterprise world.   As a member of the EEA, PayPie will collaborate with industry leaders to help spread the benefits of trust and transparency brought by the blockchain to industries worldwide. EEA’s membership represents a wide variety of business sectors from every region of the world, including technology, banking, government, healthcare, energy, pharmaceuticals, marketing, and insurance, as well as a number of fast-growing Ethereum startups. The EEA’s wide range of vendor-led, industry-specific application layer working groups and committees are committed to increasing the adoption of Ethereum technology in the enterprise.   “We are always searching for new ways of strengthening the blockchain technology community as a whole and of growing our own partnerships ecosystem with organizations that bring new synergies to the platform. The support for blockchain improvement and adoption must be constant to enable fintech companies like PayPie to expand and bring value to an ever-growing business audience eager for credit disruption,” said PayPie’s CMO Yohan Varella.

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Here is the main text of the latest news from PAYPIE and DEBITUM.  PAYPIE CREDIT RISK ASSESSMENT TO BE ADOPTED BY DEBITUM NETWORK  VANCOUVER, Canada, February 9, 2018 – PayPie and Debitum Network announced today that the business credit risk assessment powered by blockchain technology provided by PayPie will be adopted by Debitum Network as its dedicated blockchain-based risk score provider for business loans exclusively for businesses in North America.  The PayPie and the Debitum teams have come to an agreement for developing a partnership with joint interests in expanding their array of benefits to broader audiences across platforms. Debitum’s CEO, Mārtiņš Liberts, said that “Debitum aims to tackle the SMEs global loan markets with constant focus on technology innovation and growth, and bringing the PayPie credit risk assessment to scrutinize businesses in North America and beyond will bring even more value to our users by granting additional trust and reliability for them to make better informed decisions.”  The partnership will involve joint efforts toward developing an integration between the platforms so Debitum Network users can directly access the PayPie scores from within the platform for greater convenience. PayPie PPP tokens will be needed for accessing the platform’s credit score, so PayPie and Debitum will agree on initially exchanging PPP tokens for Debitum DEB tokens to seed user adoption. Afterwards, PPP tokens should be directly used by Debitum users or by the Debitum platform for accessing the PayPie credit score and make it directly available through the platform. For that purpose, the Debitum Network may implement DEB to PPP exchange (automatic or manual) while any specific technical solution and integration will be designed on a later stage of the partnership. PayPie will have exclusive rights as being the only blockchain company to provide credit risk assessment and scores to Debitum and to its users and businesses in North America, while Debitum will retain the rights to provide credit risk data from other non-blockchain companies in addition to PayPie’s.  “Developing partnerships with fintech organizations such as Debitum is something that PayPie will constantly pursue as win-win synergies. Debitum users will be rewarded with the most accurate and up-to-date credit risk assessment available on the market through PayPie’s scores based on near real-time accounting data, while the PayPie platform will keep expanding its reach through new markets and audiences to solidify its unique value proposition. Interested parties are always welcome to reach us for the real business use cases in the credit industry”, said PayPie’s CMO, Yohan Varella.

Author: Challenge
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: PayPie is a sleeping giant. I am very happy to be holding a very large amount of PPP tokens. The site design is beautiful as seen by the Alpha just released yesterday (two days early). All of my experiences with this team have been optimum. They always over-deliver on their promises, and sooner or later people will realize that PayPie has the exact same type of invoice factoring system built-in to it like Populous, and so in my honest opinion I would not be surprised at all if we see the price do a 30-60X increase by the time the platform is launched (March- April) and when they finally get listed on large exchanges. Right now it is only available on EtherDelta which people find difficult to use. This is a smart investment in my opinion and I have had many friends invest large amounts into this project as-well. There is a reason that they are not listed on any large exchange at the moment and that is because of Canadian Regulation. The Alpha must complete first to prove the tokens utility before Canadian regulators will give them an exemption from filing as a security. I have done a ton of research and I also live here in Canada where PayPie is located. The investment is a no-brainer in my opinion.

Author: Challenge
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: The problem is that many people do not know how to use EtherDelta and don't want to use it. It is very hard for people to understand why this project is just as valuable as populous - actually it is more valuable due to the accounting aspect built-in.  The project needs to be discovered, and until it reaches exchanges and the marketing starts, it wont be discovered. Give it some time and the price for this token will explode due to what the token does. Any money invested into PayPie is at very little risk. Even if the token itself was to stay at a very low price, once the company finishes its beta and does a full launch, the price will skyrocket for three reasons:  A) Many of us investors will be using our tokens to buy invoices and make the 2-5% monthly profit, which means there will be very few tokens on the market for sale. This means supply and demand rules will come into effect. Less tokens listed on the exchanges, people can ask a higher price for them.  B)The PayPie token will be listed on multiple large exchanges and thus the price should  match or come very close to that of Populous, which in my opinion by that time should be around $100+. Right now the token is not listed on any exchanges because PayPie is working with Canadian regulators to get their license and securities exemption (that is in part the reason for the alpha only being related to the utility of the risk-score algorithm). PayPie is used to dealing with Canadian regulators since before the ICO even started. I am located in Canada, I know the financial laws enough to understand what PayPie is going through and that they will Succeed.  C) PayPie is being built in the same office as their parent company is located. Many people don't know that PayPie has a pre-existing company dating back to 2013/2014 which is called SlickPie and it has nothing to do with blockchain. It is an online accounting platform that people around the world have been using for the past few years. You can compare SlickPie to companies like Sage, Quickbooks Online, Xero, etc... So what does this mean? PayPie is building on top of their pre-existing business which has been very successful with tens of thousands of customers (small to medium size enterprises - SMEs).  One reason many people are confused about PayPie and do not yet see the tremendous value in this token, is because the invoice factoring part of PayPie is not being heavily promoted, and again, that is because of Canadian Regulation. Once people start learning that PayPie is like Populous on Steriods, the price will reflect that.   I have been researching and studying PayPie since it was first announced. If anyone has any questions for me regarding PayPie, I would be happy to answer them for you. You can ask me on here through a private message or in this thread.

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Habemus Alpha!  Surprise, surprise, Alpha is here! Yay! Yes, we know it's not the 31st yet, and yes, we know we're two days EARLIER than announced, but that's just how we roll! Better and faster all the way up! PayPie style!  So, first things first, let me brief you a little on what this Alpha is all about in three main points:  This is an Alpha version, which means that it’s a very basic version of how the core platform will look like once it’s fully done. In other words, it’s just a slight taste and feel of the real big things to come.   However, even despite being an Alpha, the tremendously important thing to have in mind is that the data you'll see is being directly pulled from companies connected with an accounting solution! The test companies are set up in an accounting solution and PayPie is frequently fetching the info straight from the source! And then (*dramatic sound effect*) the platform is applying the PayPie credit risk assessment algorithm to generate the scores and results you'll see! It's a working product, not screenshots!   Another main purpose of an Alpha version is to find areas of improvement on the platform, so please email our team regarding any feedback that you’d like to share. Alpha data will be frequently updated to correct data errors or issues that come up so go nuts! On a side note, we have a potential partnership being developed and they are performing security audit and stress tests on the platform, so if you experience any lag or crash that will likely be a temporary issue for this week only. The big guys are coming!  And that's basically it! Now that Alpha is out, our team is going full throttle at developing Beta. We expect to have it launched very, very soon. Things are going better than ever! As you know, Beta will bring all those wonderful functionalities that you all want to see, so stay tuned! Go ahead and enjoy Alpha while you can because it won’t last long! So here it is, the PAYPIE ALPHA: https://alpha.paypie.com  Enjoy!  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: IMO I do not care about the amount of Exchanges the PPP tokens trade on as I have no intent on selling them. I bought into the ICO because I wanted to use this utility token on the companies platform. I want to participate in the lending of funding to the companies and make a healthy ROI.  Tha utility value of the tokens will increase over time and I will use my tokens over and over again to earn income.  Have look at PPT who was out of the gate first on this invoice factoring (in this blockchain) world and look where that company stands now.  The additional Exchanges will follow in time but it is best that the company concentrates on the credit risk, platform development and obtain deals with SME's first. I am personally hoping that in the future that the PayPie management approach Reggie Middleton of Veritaseum and see about listing PPP on the VeADIR platform.  Here is a few words from Reggie Middleton on 6 January 2018.  Exchange listed coins currently having to pony up a million to get listed! "Listing on VeADIR can legitimize a project, based off of fundamentals vs exchange listing fees - the very same rent seeking model applied to crypto that btc set out to undercut in the 1st place."  This sounds like a good move to me. Why should PayPie pay big money for an Exchange listing when they do not require one?

Author: meta100000
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Adding to the Whitepaper, there is the latest blog posts:  One Small Step for PayPie, One Giant Leap for SMEs Posted on January 12, 2018 by Nick Chandi  The lack of transparency in business data keeps most financial advisors, lenders, and investors up at night. And if you are an SME selling on credit, you must be feeling credit stress on a fairly regular basis. The world today needs a solution that can look at financial data and offer tools to ward off fraud to propel businesses to the next level.  PayPie is disrupting the way business is being done. Our credit risk analysis along with blockchain-powered publicly visible Credit Risk Scores is going to help millions of SMEs change their financial expectations.  In a relatively short period, our platform is introducing a product and that has been out of reach to SME’s worldwide.  The alpha version of our platform is officially being launched on January 31, 2018, and we couldn’t be happier about it. Our whole team has been putting the highest effort and care to develop this wonderful way for SMEs to improve their realities. This alpha version will be solely focused on the credit risk assessment side so you can have a good taste of what’s to come.  Alphas are known for being far from perfect, but we are very happy with the way the platform is behaving so far and we hope you will be too.  PayPie will not only analyze accounting data and apply Artificial Intelligence (AI) analytics to see whether a business will succeed or default, but will also support an entire ecosystem. Accountants will be able to give their clients actionable financial insights, lenders will be able to reduce underwriting times and costs, an investor in South Africa will be able to provide credit to a business in USA, all because of our cloud infrastructure powered by blockchain thus opening new doors for endless possibilities that reinvigorate the economy.  I would love to live in a decentralized world, but today we still need to integrate with the pre-existing global economy. That being said, we have already built the core framework that will allow us to focus on USA\Canada first and to expand globally in a scalable way based on our success in these markets. We are starting with the credit risk assessment side of the platform and we will share other details on further services at the right time.  We at the PayPie are very confident and excited about our vision. I have never seen a community and team more inspired, dedicated and talented than the ones we are blessed in having. Collectively, we will bring peace of mind to both SMEs and thousands of our supporters who are waiting for us to change the world.  PayPie, you will like it hot!

Author: meta100000
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: ...and the Alfa annoucement:  Alpha Is Coming! Posted on January 12, 2018 by Yohan Varella  Alpha Is Coming!  Oh yeah! Oh 2018… Such a young year and already bringing so much joy to our hearts. Yes my friends, our delightful alpha version is coming on the early side of our hopes! Our team is always putting our hearts and souls into the development of this platform that I guess things are conspiring in our favor because our alpha is already looking hot and steamy!  I myself have been diving deep into the UI and UX waters to help our developers bring not only a world-class technical platform for you, but a platform that looks and feels great, a platform that you just can’t get your hands out of. Of course, this is still an alpha version and alphas are well known for being far from perfect, but we are very happy with the overall performance of it and I’m sure you will be too! So without further ado:  THE PAYPIE ALPHA WILL BE OFFICIALLY LAUNCHED ON JANUARY 31!  Our alpha version will solely focus on the credit risk assessment side of the platform. That part should be first polished so we can then move on to deeper waters knowing that all data will be as accurate as we envision. This will be a great opportunity for the community to FLOOD us with feedback to help us take PayPie to the crypto Olympus!  And hey, we have another outstanding news for you! After getting hundreds and hundreds of emails from people interested in joining out alpha testing phase we decided to run a completely PUBLIC ALPHA testing open for all willing to join! Woo-hoo! Our beta testing phase will still be closed, but hey, everyone can just go nuts on alpha!  Speaking about beta, we will have plenty of juicy, and I mean, juicy info for you coming soon after alpha is released. Beta is already under development and things are moving at full speed. But first, let us all enjoy and test the $h!% out of alpha! One sweet slice of pie at a time!  And just a note on our website revamp: we will only update a couple of things during alpha and will save the massive shiny stuff for when beta comes. The website is being completely revamped and PayPie will have a new face very soon. Trust me, it will worth the wait!  So save the date everybody! January 31, 2018! Alpha is coming!

Author: Wheelige
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Does anyone know of anything planned to bring down the congestion on the eth chain? At this point in time 20-30 gas is a minimum, which is driving transaction fees through the roof. What happened to the days of a 10 gwei transaction being confirmed in under a minute? Is it just post-kitties everyone is now using 20 gwei as a floor and this will continue to creep up as more people look for a slightly faster transaction making 40 be the new norm in a month and 80 the next month. The congestion on the eth chain could have a huge impact on every token that rides on that chain. PPP might be caught requiring users to dump $5-10 a transaction to use their smart contracts when their platform is live.

Author: mahmutyes
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: How do we see the tokens ? manual input ?

Author: Chrmel612
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Nope. Actually the network is congested right now. There's like 40k+ pending txs. And that numbers make it hard for the transaction to be confirmed. And so many people are setting the gas price higher so that their transaction can be processed on the next block. If it continues, tx fees will be as much as high with bitcoin.

Our whole team has been putting the highest effort and care to develop this wonderful way for SMEs to improve their realities. This alpha version will be solely focused on the credit risk assessment side so you can have a good taste of what’s to come.  Alphas are known for being far from perfect, but we are very happy with the way the platform is behaving so far and we hope you will be too.  PayPie will not only analyze accounting data and apply Artificial Intelligence (AI) analytics to see whether a business will succeed or default, but will also support an entire ecosystem. Accountants will be able to give their clients actionable financial insights, lenders will be able to reduce underwriting times and costs, an investor in South Africa will be able to provide credit to a business in USA, all because of our cloud infrastructure powered by blockchain thus opening new doors for endless possibilities that reinvigorate the economy.  I would love to live in a decentralized world, but today we still need to integrate with the pre-existing global economy. That being said, we have already built the core framework that will allow us to focus on USA\Canada first and to expand globally in a scalable way based on our success in these markets. We are starting with the credit risk assessment side of the platform and we will share other details on further services at the right time.  We at the PayPie are very confident and excited about our vision. I have never seen a community and team more inspired, dedicated and talented than the ones we are blessed in having. Collectively, we will bring peace of mind to both SMEs and thousands of our supporters who are waiting for us to change the world.  PayPie, you will like it hot!

Author: octain
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hey guys thanks for all the excellent responses.  I email Paypie and I got to admit it was an extreme professional and well thought out email. I have heard of issues around tokens and securities and that I get now is a real issue.  All token need to be very careful they are not miss represented as security. Which makes sense other wise there is regularitity issues. Paypie is no different. So the token needs to be used as that a function of the network.  Therefor until the platform is ready and working there is no use for the token other then speculation. Which, makes it look like a security rather then a utility token. Once the platform is up and working the token can be added to exchanges as the utility has a use.  I’m guessing there is a whole heap of reasons to not make your utility look like a security. I’m not sure of the specifics however I did happen to read bittrex won’t accept any token that is being treated like a security and it is possible other exchanges have the same policy.  So if your waiting for Paypie to be added to more exchanges hold you tokens until the platform is up and working.

Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Official response below, cut and paste email, removed name for privacy reasons.  Hi ***** Thanks for reaching out. PPP is a utility token that can be used for credit risk assessment and other services offered by PayPie platform.   Regarding your question about listing PPP on other exchanges, as PayPie tokens (PPP) are utility tokens, we as a company, cannot and will not be actively involved in discussions regarding trading tokens/ market price/ future price estimates/ exchanges. However, all measures for the platform’s development are already being taken and our team is now putting all their efforts on delivering the roadmap milestones. PayPie platform is moving forward as expected, which means it is just a matter of time until the platform’s benefits can be available to all token holders. Once the platform is ready, we will support information from exchanges if they request it.   Please let us know if you have any other questions.   Simmi 720-999 West Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1K5 https://www.paypie.com   PayPie

Author: octain
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: My serious concern about paypie and the future.  I’m sure the Paypie team monitor these forums so I guess it’s approriate to comment here and assume they will see it.  I saw an email a while ago, from a telegram user who emailed Yohan regarding PPP being added to other exchanges. His response some what shocked me and really has stuck me. He stated that Paypie where not Interested in having their tokens being added to other exchanges as the ppp token was a function of the network and not a token purely for being traded.  It got me thinking and how tokens really give you no assureance of what your actually buying. These tokens don’t give you a right to the profits or offer you any opportunity to profit. We have basically handed over cash for them, with absolutely no understanding of what will return value for us. Their not shares and even if Paypie was hugely successful what’s stopping Paypie effectively never using these tokens for anything.  I’ve watched a lot of you tube videos and even asked on telegram. I’ve noticed when asked Paypie almost always dodges the question of the purpose of the ppp token.  This leads me to my next problem. The only place to trade Paypie is Etherdelta. Since the recent hack of Etherdelta Paypie has struggled to hold its value. Etherdelta it seems, is now not trusted by the general community of crpto traders. If it did disappear their is absolutely no where to trade this token and given the attitude of Paypie it’s unlikely they would want it to be traded on exchanges. Etherdelta in itself isn’t really an exchange, more a market place for people to swap their tokens for ether directly. So as someone who owns several hundred of thousands of Paypie where do I go from here? Paypie is an awesome project that I 100% believe in. Yet I have no idea if it is successful if I’ll even profit from this ! I have no idea if in the future I’ll be able to exchange this token for cash. Given the huge  amount of money I have tied up in this, it is deeply concerns me. Looking st the price seems I’m not the only person with these concerns and do I just dump and run from here, I’ve made good money but get out while the times are good.  I’m an descrite for some guidance on this as are others. I think it’s a fair question. If Paypie don’t want to add PPP to other exchanges, they should be transparent about it. Obviously we all got into this to make money and I believe it is only fair the investors who helped build this platform profit from it.

Is because of that they do not talk about exchanges or the price of the token, thats does not mean they can't (or will not) add the token in a exchange, is just that they will not do it without a product (a use of PPP as utility), because they are expericed and do not want to screw this over!!! Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hi all,  Great news! The PayPie community has shown its strength once again and we've made it to the semi-finals of the 15th Annual SBBC Awards under Best Concept category! Over 600 businesses were nominated and the top ones of each category made into the semi-finals, which means that you guys were awesome!  Now it's up to the judges. They will get into action and will select their favorite businesses for the big finals, so fingers crossed and keep the good vibes up! Here is their press release in case you want to check it out: http://smallbusinessbc.ca/press-release/top-10-semi-finalists-announced-15th-annual-small-business-bc-awards  Also, last week we offered you to enroll in our Alpha/Beta testing stages and your involvement was awesome! Yeah, we know, your involvement is always awesome but we never get tired of acknowledging that whenever we can just because it's true.  Hundreds of people applied and we're doing the best we can to accommodate as many of you as possible. We'll soon contact all the approved testers, but now it's time to shift all that wonderful energy to an even better use.  We're looking for established SMEs with innovative spirits and thirst for growth to be among the very first ever to get their business credit score assessed by the power of blockchain accounting! These SMEs will have a head-start with our platform, so if you are an SME owner, an SME employee, or even know of SMEs that would benefit from a sharp new technological avenue, fill this form now and share it with everyone you know! For real!  Dedicated form:  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScnt9ys0Ws00f_YU4_In3FyrUziOEO8SnJAbTW2TvQHpTNJoQ/viewform?usp=sf_link  This is your time to shine!  Cheers.

Author: KLN_IT
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: This is really a great project guys!! For those of you who invest and then cry because the price went down, maybe should reevaluate what your strategy is.  Don't go blasting a project because you didn't get a 10x or 50x return when you bought in.  These projects take time to develop.  Go to the whitepaper for additional information if necessary.  Don't invest more than you're willing to lose.  Do your own research, there is a ton of sites and information out there! I understand there is a herd of people moving into the crypto space, I get it, you saw someone go from nothing to a millionaire in a week or so and you want a piece of the action! Been there done that, but don't get all pissy when it doesn't happen for you and then cry foul or it's a scam because you lost on your initial investment.  These companies are just starting up and it will take time to develop.  Get a bag full when you can, have patience and sit back and ride it out.  Paypie from various sources I have is looking at a pretty good increase for 2018...anywhere from $8-15 dollars...even Clif High has mentioned this as well.  He's been uncannily accurate on crypto for awhile now.  No, hes not right about everything, but, some of this stuff he's mentioned, I've bought, and, well it's been pretty good to be honest.  So just get you a bag when you can and HODL for the long haul.  PPP is currently up 30% today and really, .75 cents is a steal in my opinion considering where it will be this time next year.  Look at it like this, ETH was $9 this time last year...yea, where we at today in ETH....$460 currently?  Exactly!!!! Just HODL guys and have some patience.  When we have a blood red day, buy more, don't sell!! I am enjoying my 3x increase at the moment, haven't sold one token yet.  The end result will be AMAZING!!  See you guys on the beach!!!

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: An update from the company is posted below.  Hello PayPiers!  First things first. If you haven't done so already, take a 10 second break from all the Black Friday fun you've been having and vote now for PayPie's Best Concept nomination in the SBBC Awards! It only takes one click:   Last chance: http://sbbcawards.ca/award/concept/paypie/  Cool. Now that you've done your civic duty and helped making PayPie into the global powerhouse we all know it will become, let's talk business.  As you may know, we'll have some slick platform screenshots to share with you guys in a couple of weeks. From a development perspective, we've been heavily focusing on the structural workflow of the platform and now we are just putting the whipped cream on top for nice and shiny interface. I could get my hands on the material our devs have made and I can tell you - it's shiny!  We're also expanding our growth channels for 2018. Besides the already planned partnerships and integrations for strengthening our credit risk assessment usage in Q1, new opportunities are already being knitted for bringing some extra SME muscle down the road. New financial groups and fintech companies have reached us out and we were happy to present with our cutting-edge technology proposition, so the bottom line is that everything is going swell both from the development side and from the growth side.  I'm already craving for sharing those slick screenshots with y'all. Our unique credit risk assessment platform based on blockchain accounting is looking better and better and a lot will happen in the next few months. As always, stay tuned!  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: buyabit
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Islapdonkey,  Where exactly on Etherscan does it show anyone (other than the company) holding at least 20% of the PAYPIE tokens? Are you just assuming that this whale acquired 20% of the tokens and then sold most of them off?  Etherscan clearly shows that (at this current time) the second largest wallet holder owns 3,685,555.365425 PAYPIE tokens, which represents a 2.2337% of the tokens in circulation.  On the 8 October 2017 the company advised: "Note: we have signed a deal with a strategic partner for contributing to the platform's development in a long term commitment. The terms of the agreement are confidential and this partnership is one of the most valuable things that could have happened for the platform's progress."  What is so difficult about interpreting the companies information contained within the above note?  If you do not agree with the companies decisions perhaps you should just find another company, which may be more in-line with your needs.

It literally only takes 10 seconds so do it right now!  Vote Now Here: http://sbbcawards.ca/award/concept/paypie/  Thank you for the support in bringing exciting and innovative technology to change the world of business financials. If it is fixed in dollar terms then the price of the token is irrelevant since you just need more or less tokens to pay the same dollar amount for usage.

Author: Wapinter
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hi all,   A few updates and info here. These past couple of weeks have been hectic with hundreds and hundreds of emails regarding the tokensale. The vast majority of you have already successfully claimed your tokens, but if you still haven't done it please follow these instructions to get it all done within a few minutes: https://www.paypie.com/addtoken  Okay, now that we got that part covered let's move to the info and updates:  - The team is already moving things ahead at full steam. All focus has been shifted from the tokensale to the platform's development and we are all immersed in that. All structural measures are already being taken and our team is now putting all efforts on delivering on all roadmap milestones, so everything is moving as expected and all goals will be met.  - Our website is being revamped to reflect a business and product instead of a tokensale. Sections will keep being altered, removed, or implemented accordingly from now on to convey our message so potential business users of the platform can start the awareness and onboarding process.  - We signed agreements with Robert Half, Angus One, and Tek Systems, three major local placement agencies to hand-pick the best talent on the market to expand our development team. A few candidates have already been pre-listed and interviewed, so our team will get bigger very soon.  - For the ones that participated in our bounty program, please note that bounties will continue to be distributed on a regular basis and we aim to finish all bounties distribution by October 27th. Please refer any bounty-related questions to our bounty manager Wapinter on BCT. Emails and chat messages about bounties will be deleted and won't be replied.  And that's it for today! Updates will be shared in mini-batches like this whenever a new set of info pieces get together. Stay tuned.  Note 1: we've received many applications from people interested in helping with the development of the platform in some way. We kindly ask you to refrain from contacting us about that at the moment. We will soon expressly request for such applications through our website.  Note 2: Since our team has all efforts focused on working for moving the platform ahead as soon as possible we won't be actively posting on the Telegram group chat. The group chat will remain as a medium for members to exchange constructive ideas among themselves, so any official info from the team will solely be shared on the Telegram announcements channel (https://t.me/PayPie) and through email. If you have any specific questions, the best and appropriate way for anyone to directly communicate with the team is by emailing us at help@paypie.com. All emails will regularly be replied within 24 hours on business days.  Remember: our only official website is https://www.paypie.com/  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: panorama
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: It's not illogical and has happened with other tokens as well (Pillar, Propy, Aventis). Once there's some early buzz a lot of people think they can make money with a quick flip, helping the ICO sell out quickly. But unless there's ALSO significant excess demand from people who want in, but weren't quick enough (or who couldn't invest because of KYC restrictions), there won't be any buyers to flip to.  If the entire ICO buyer pool was made up of long-term holders, the token price probably wouldn't go below ICO. But if you've got that large pool of flippers, they get nervous very quickly and will try to move on to the next trade if they don't see things moving right away. The first flipper might only sell for a tiny loss, but this starts a wave once the others start getting skittish and it starts the downward trend.  This can all be exacerbated by strategic advisors/investors or bounty participants who got in cheaper than the ICO.  It's all just human emotion and the quality of the token may not have anything to do with it. This was my rationale for the price "prediction" earlier. You won't see upward movement until there's real news from the company, but in the case of PayPie, I don't expect that to be until mid-2018 based on their roadmap. It's got nothing to do with creating FUD.

Author: panorama
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: I know this is a PPP thread, but I thought I'd comment on REAL since you brought it up and I was reviewing it earlier today. REAL tokens have no fundamental reason to trade above ICO value for a LONG time, so keep that in mind as the max price.  The value should creep back up to the ICO price once the first property is available to invest in. REAL tokens have no use other than providing the right to invest so they are just being held in anticipation and should trade below ICO until that time.  * this analysis assumes that crypto investors are fully informed and act rationally, which we all know that they don't. So while there's no fundamental reason for the REAL token to trade above the ICO price, who knows what will actually happen.  [Back to your regularly scheduled PPP discussion]

Author: Dorkie
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: You guys that hold PPP should ask the PayPie team how will they help to recover an investment in case an invoice defaults. What are the steps taken to reduce the chance of default (before it does) and how to recover the investment in case of default (after it does)?  So far I can see the team never make any specific statement/policy on this.   Edit: If they give some bullshit answer like, "We are gonna do a credit rating on the invoices", then probe them by saying how exactly/precisely will a credit rating going to help reduce default and/or recover a default?   For once, this question on prevention and recovery in case of default needs to be addressed. It appears to me the team is not bothered with this.  For crying out loud, credit risk score on the SME is just a tiny preventive measure.  There is still much to do with figuring out the credit risk score of the debtor stated in the invoice. And still much to do with recovery in case of a default, regardless of whatever the credit risk score.  Guys, if you want PayPie to be like Populous, you need to beat the PayPie team of Indians into clarifying all these.

Author: panorama
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Uhh...wrong  First neither of us suggested that invoice factoring was their exclusive focus, so I'm not sure why you made that assumption. However, it is on their roadmap and their approach deserves to be questioned.  Second, suggesting that they'll be selling their data to companies like Populous is a stretch since they expect to have their own source of credit data and likely won't have to buy anything from PayPie.  This is especially true since I don't think PayPie can pull off their plan to bring SME accounting on to the blockchain, so I have more interest in other areas of their business model.  So, get your facts straight before acting like you know what you're talking about.

Author: panorama
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Yes, I invested in Populous, but I have no incentive to create FUD. PayPie already raised their money through the ICO, so they have enough capital to compete with Populous regardless of how the tokens are priced in the future.  That said, I'd be happy to make money with both if I saw the potential. I don't have anything against PPP. I just think it's too early to invest, but I'm keeping an eye on it because it could have longer term potential.  Of course I might be wrong, but there's actually a rationale behind my comments.  What I'm saying isn't automatically FUD because you don't agree with it. If you disagree, tell me what you think could drive the price to go up before mid-2018.

Author: Gen6:6
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: To everyone already moaning about the company (even after investing in it) - investments are supposed to be long term to see the real fruit of the work, too bad you didn't get your 10x flip in the 3 day period you wanted. Also, they are probably sworn to secrecy at this stage regarding any deals with other companies and do NOT owe you anything just because you invested something pathetically small like 30 ETH into this company. In the real world of investment and company startups $10,000 investment in nothing. If you threw a few ETH in or even went up to 75 ETH it is just too small for you to be taken seriously. It is pocket change. PayPie owes you nothing and does not have to tell you anything. Do you think they will sacrifice their future success for a few thousand riffraff everyday people like us??! Just go sell your tokens if you don't like it.  Meanwhile, I will sit on mine and enjoy the fruits in YEARS (not days) to come.

Author: oregonpb
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: I believe these types of deals will become far more common over the coming years. While I don't agree with the last minute notice of how this went down, i'm equally not surprised by it.  IN the future it would be nice if these deals were broadcast a week or so before any ICO contribution period, that way folks can choose to participate or not participate after giving it some thought and research.   To the extreme of calling this a SCAM and creating FUD, this seems to be going too far.  If you want a heavily regulated market go participate in IPO's, those occur all the time.  I suspect those are more rigged than most of these known ICO's, but you might get the feeling of knowing what you are buying into.  Too each his/her own.  When the coin is distributed and listed on exchanges sell if you don't like the project, hold, or buy more if you think it will go higher.  Simple as that.

Author: Wapinter
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hi all!   So, what should I say? Ah, such a wonderful day it was! Seriously, the adrenaline frenzy was spreading everywhere! That was wild!  By now you all must know that the pre-sale was a huge success and all tokens were sold out in just a few hours. We had planned to run an entire tokensale until mid-November and all measures had also been prepared for that. Pre-sale was such an astonishing surprise for us and the usage demand for risk algorithm is huge. Keep your PPP utility tokens safe, as they will power the usage of world’s first credit risk algorithm based on blockchain accounting in just few short months.  So as many of you have already requested - here they are! Your tokens are here! Oh yeah!  Please follow the these instructions (they'll also be added to our website in the following hours). There are two mandatory steps that you must take:  Step 1- Send 0 (it's a zero) ETH to our pre-sale contract address from your wallet address that you used to participate in presale Step 2- Create a custom token on your wallet  Directions below are for the MyEtherWallet, the wallet that was recommended for the token sale.  To complete step 1 you must:  a) Enter " 0 " (it's a zero) on the Amount to Send field b) Enter " 0xf8a15b1540d5f9d002d9ccb7fd1f23e795c2859d " on the "To Address" field c) Enter " 250000 " on the "Gas Limit" field d) Enter " 0x48c54b9d " on the "Data" field (to enable "Data" just click on "+Advanced Data: Add Data" e) Click on "Generate Transaction" then just check to see if your transaction was sent  (FYI: don't enter any "quotation marks" on the fields)  After you complete step 1 you can move on to step 2. This is how you create a custom token on MyEtherWallet to complete step 2:  a) Click on "View Wallet Info" and then click on "Create a Custom Token" b) Enter " 0xc42209accc14029c1012fb5680d95fbd6036e2a0 " on the "Address" field c) Enter " PPP " on the "Token Symbol" field d) Enter " 18 " on the "Decimals" field e) Click on "Save"  (FYI: don't enter any "quotation marks" on the fields)  And that's it! Your tokens will be automatically added to your wallet after that and you'll be good to go!  Thank you once again and have fun!  Security note 1: it's very unfortunate that a few people were victim of scams practiced by websites and/or people pretending to pass like our official website and team. Those websites are all FAKE WEBSITES! If you unfortunately ended up sending any ETH to them there is nothing that PayPie can do since this is something completely out of our control. As we mentioned several times, our only official website is https://www.paypie.com/ .  Security note 2: Seems like a few contributors did not follow directions and used some other wallet than MyEtherWallet thus limiting your ability to add a custom token. If you made a mistake, you will need to contact the support team of those wallets.  Cheers,

Author: Chef Ramsay
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Quote Of the many positive aspects of the PayPie business concept, the most powerful is the contextual connection via the principles to the very large, deep, and lucrative world of business accounting software. This connection, as well as personnel involved will provide the boost for PayPie over other competition within the space. By having the base of the previous sales of their accounting software, PayPie gains at several levels. First the sheer size of the customer base as potential low-cost customers for PayPie. Second, from having done it once as the completed sales and software cycles of the accounting businesses translate skills and knowledge to the new effort. Third from the known and tested crew having been there, experienced the problems, and overcome. Fourth from the combination of the customer base, that is to say, from the in-built network effect of such a large, and growing universe of lower cost sales.

Author: Hunterman3609
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: I have a quick question on whether I purchased the coins correctly. I am not sure it worked.  I was not present at the ICO opening. I had to go out. When I got back it was about 79 mill out of 82 mill completed. I panicked a bit.  I had some Litecoin and OmiseGO. I had to convert them in separate transactions to get some ETH. I got 6 ETH and 5.5 ETH. One completed before the other though, and I dared not wait to buy the Paypie tokens. Shapeshift can sometimes take hours to convert coins.  From MyetherWallet, I first sent 6 ETH for Paypie tokens. About 10 minutes later I sent another transaction from the same MyetherWallet to buy another 5.5 ETC. Together they are under the limit of 75 ETH.  However, when I did the second 5.5 ETH buyin, a red message came up at the bottom of the screen, indicating that I had already sent a transaction to the same address. It just seemed like a notification message though. It did not indicate that the transaction was blocked. I have checked the logs, and both 6 and 5.5 ETH transactions were successful and 11.5 ETH has left my wallet.  I am just wondering if the second 5.5 ETH will be blocked though by Paypie, and they will have to refund the ETH to me, and I will only have got 6 ETH worth of Paypie?  I do not think that the instructions specfically said that you could only make 1 transaction from 1 wallet. Only that you could not buy more than 75 ETH of tokens.  Does somebody have a definitive answer as to whether I have done it right, and will get the full 11.5 ETH of tokens?  Sincerely  Keith

Author: a14m
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: First, I wanna say that I do really appreciate @Nick and @Yohan for being willing to answer questions even when you’ve already been asked the same thing over and over every single day. And you have been very accommodating to the communities needs. Mucho appreciated.  Now onto issues:  I got a bonus and I wasn't even expecting one. Cool. Unfortunately, what isn’t cool, is the Paypie team said one thing and did another. Bonuses were supposed to go to the smaller contributors. But that's not what happened.  The payee team did not release the bonus structure openly for everyone to review until right before the pre-sale started. At the time, I honestly didn’t think much about until now. Now when I really stop and think about it everything, it all seems kind of shady how this whole thing has played out.  So lets review:  This morning a email was sent out right before the crowdsale with this Note attached to the bottom:   “Note: we have signed a deal with a strategic partner for contributing to the platform's development in a long term commitment. The terms of the agreement are confidential and this partnership is one of the most valuable things that could have happened for the platform's progress. We just wanted to share that bit with the community before the pre-sale. Future looks bright!”    According to the white paper, 82,500,500 PPP tokens would be available for the crowdsale.  1ETH = 909 PPP tokens(0.0011 ETH = 1 PPP)   Smart Contract? Yes  82,500,000 PPP Max Hard cap for Crowdsale  4,500,000  PPP soft cap minimum req for crowdsale  27,500,000 PPP for Team and Advisors  55,000,000 PPP for Industry Reserve to help develop partnerships and future acquisitions to become a dominant market leader.  Accoring the the contract ETH provided to us today (0xf8A15b1540d5f9D002D9cCb7FD1F23E795c2859d) = (0xF821Fd99BCA2111327b6a411C90BE49dcf78CE0f)   61,082 ETH was contributed publicly which means 55,523,538 PPP tokens were bought publicly.  This leave 26,976, 462 tokens left that are unaccounted for.   Hypothetically, If everyone had gotten a bonus of 5%(we all know that didn’t happen) then that would then give contributors as a whole 1,348,823 PPP tokens. But that still would leave 25,627,639 PPP tokens left.  This begs the question, why wasn’t this transaction or set of transactions of roughly 26,976,62 PPP tokens recorded on the blockchain at the same time as and under the same contract address as the rest of the crowd sale?? And if this was a strategic partnership deal as stated in the thank you email this morning, then why didn’t the paypie team  use the INDUSTRY RESERVE tokens of 55,000,000 to make this deal instead of taking from the crowdsale AND also at the same time renege on a earlier agreement of giving smaller donors a bonus? The argument that giving everyone a bonus is not really a bonus is very shallow argument and a slap in the face to small investors. Because if going off of that logic, then I see no reason why Paypie shouldn’t have been able to stick to the original agreement which gave the smaller donors the bonus and none for the larger donors.   Also why did you feel that you had to make a SECRET NDA deal with business individuals to advance the company along?  How are we to trust that you have investors and also future customer’s  best interest at heart when nothing about the deal has been disclosed???   How is anyone supposed to be okay with that and be expected to just blindly trust you? This is a new era guys and what would have been acceptable in the old fiat, large corporation way of doing business, is NOT okay in the blockchain era. Blockchain requires transparency and the was the absolute opposite.  This wasn’t in the white paper guys and you need to make it right.

Author: Whitescarf
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: So uhhh....  I received the Pre-sale email and used the link supplied in the email to get to the proper site "https://www.paypie.com/".  When the countdown timer hit zero the website lagged terribly.  Even after agreeing to the contract (the 4 checkboxes) I could not click continue.  I reloaded the page then started over, this time successful....I thought.  I still have not received any PPP tokens, it's been hours.  Then I noticed this....  Account I sent ETH to (according to etherscan): 0xf8A15b1540d5f9D002D9cCb7FD1F23E795c2859d  Account that NOW shows when I try to buy more PPP tokens on "https://www.paypie.com/presale": 0xf8a15b1540d5f9d002d9ccb7fd1f23e795c2859d  I was given both accounts when following the "Contribute Now" process but they are different in their capitalizations...should I be worried?!  UPDATE WHILE WRITING THIS:  Just got an email from Simmi at Paypie.  The capitalizations do not matter!  The two addresses are the same.  "It’s the same address just one in upper case and the other in lower case. We will send you the instructions on how to claim your tokens within 14 business days."  Phew..

Author: Wapinter
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hello Again!   Here are the final instructions for the pre-sale. The bulk of it was already announced two days ago, so this email aims simply to clarify some procedures.  Reminder: join us on Telegram now!  We've also just created a new announcements-only channel! Join us now!  First, let me set this straight: the smart contract has been deployed and no further changes are possible from this point onward.  Okay, so here's the further information:  - This page contains the instructions listed below, so you can just directly access for a more detailed explanation: https://www.paypie.com/tutorial  - The last five digits of our address are: 2859d Please, please, please, check the address before you send your ETH.  - The entire address will be published only on our official website on the very moment that the pre-sale is open. Our official website is https://www.paypie.com/  - Once the pre-sale time is reached, our website will update to show an orange button saying "Pre-Sale Is Open! Join Now!". You'll just have to click on it and then follow the instructions on "Contribute Now!"  - The best thing you can do is to go on our website a few minutes before the pre-sale is open and refresh the page to see the pre-sale button update.  - The recommended gas limit will be 200,000.  - There won't be a gwei limit.  - MyEtherWallet is still the recommended wallet. Jaxx integration is still in the works so we recommend MEW for the pre-sale.  - Bonus structure will be available on the day of the pre-sale.   That's it folks! The time is coming! Make sure  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: In the last pages that subject has been discussed. I am a bit skeptical about a Canadian legal team claiming they are in the clear with respect to American regulations, but here it is:   Quote from: Wapinter on October 05, 2017, 10:38:07 PM PayPie will accept contributions from residents of most countries, including USA and Canada. Our legal team is of the view that our tokens do not meet the definition of “securities” under Canadian law. Our ongoing discussions with Canadian regulators have been very positive and we will continue to work with the regulators leading up to the token crowdsale and on an ongoing basis.  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: If you want that kind of information, you should subscribe their newsletter, many people have already told it. Here is what i got from the newsletter :  About the pre-sale structure, we also have some terrific news for you! We decreased both the Individual Minimum and the Individual Cap for the pre-sale! We wanted to democratize participation as much as possible so everyone can enroll, so check it out:   Pre-Sale Structure  - Opens: October 08th, at 13:00 UTC  - Closes: October 15th, at 12:00 UTC  - Individual Minimum: 0.5 ETH  - Individual Cap: 75 ETH  - Price per Token: 0.0011 ETH  - Total Soft Cap: 4,500,000 PPP  - Total Hard Cap: 82,500,000 PPP  - Only Currency Accepted: ETH  - Whitelist: No  - Smart Contract: Yes  - USA/Canada Allowed: Yes  - Tokens Delivery: Within 14 business days after tokensale completion  - Bonus: TBA. There will be a bonus for smaller contributors to benefit from. We want to prevent “pumping and dumping” from happening and you won’t see anything astronomic like in some other tokensales out there. PayPie is legit and we want contributors that are in it for its real value proposition.

Author: Wapinter
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: Hello Everyone!   Here’s a fresh from the oven scoop for you – PayPie to Be Integrated into Jaxx multi-token wallet! PayPie and Decentral have just issued a joint press release officially announcing that Anthony Di Iorio has joined the PayPie team and that PayPie will be integrated into Jaxx! That’s thrilling news! Check it out:   "Anthony Di Iorio Joins PayPie Team; PayPie to Be Integrated into Jaxx   6th October 2017 – Decentral Community Space – TORONTO – Decentral Inc, home of the Jaxx Blockchain Interface and the Decentral Community announced today that Anthony Di Iorio, Founder of Decentral and CEO of Jaxx, and Co-Founder of the Ethereum platform, is joining PayPie as both an advisor and as a prominent supporter.   Anthony and the Decentral team are eager to support projects with experienced entrepreneurs delivering blockchain innovation, like  PayPie. Anthony said that “by introducing the world’s first Ethereum-powered credit risk assessment based on decentralized accounting, PayPie hopes to bring ultimate trust and transparency to the financial market. I’m a believer in the power of decentralized technologies like PayPie to add huge value to existing auditing markets and practices. Supporting PayPie’s team in a key advisory role and by integrating the PayPie token into Jaxx are the ways I’m most eager to pitch in.”   The PayPie decentralized, blockchain-based platform was built to make the financial information on businesses more accurate and transparent, allowing a better picture of a company’s financial health for credit risk assessment. Anthony continued, “PayPie leverages blockchain to enable live financial audits, speed up credit approvals, and improve the overall credit scoring processes for businesses. It’s a huge improvement in efficiency for lenders, auditors, accountants, and other financial institutions.”   “Often a company’s financial situation is inaccurate, due to a lack of information and the fact that this information is usually outdated”, said PayPie CEO, serial entrepreneur, and member of the Forbes Technology Council, Nick Chandi. “By harnessing technology – blockchain in particular – we can avoid these issues and make the system fairer both for the businesses themselves, as well as those who wish to access the financial information. Anthony’s participation as a key strategic advisor and the integration of our token into the Jaxx platform are great accelerator to our future.”   Link to Decentral’s press release (also available on their homepage): http://decentral.ca/anthony-di-iorio-joins-paypie-team-paypie-integrated-jaxx/  Link to PayPie’s press release: http://blog.paypie.com/uncategorized/anthony-di-iorio-joins-paypie-team-paypie-to-be-integrated-into-jaxx/   That's some thrilling news!  Regarding the pre-sale, we're sharing further info today! Stay tuned!  Cheers,   Yohan Varella CMO

Author: viljy
Title: [ANN] PayPie - Blockchain-Powered Risk Assessment
Body: The organization can provide false information, so Paypie must conduct an independent audit before something is written down in the blockchain. By launching its platform, Paypie is responsible for the reliability and relevance of information for assessing the financial condition of organizations. After all, the risk assessment will be based on this information. But the organizations that provide information are not responsible. Therefore, I have long asked how they will receive reliable information. Will there be a bunch of scammers with false financial statements, just to get a loan. Paypie must check them all, otherwise the whole business will collapse. The blockchain is not a universal protection against fraud. First, absolutely correct information must be recorded there.
